news_header: German police arrested eight members of a far-right group plotting a Nazi-inspired coup.
news_text: Eight suspected members of a far-right group, the Saxony Separatists, were arrested by German police for allegedly planning a coup inspired by Nazi ideology. The group was reportedly undergoing military training to prepare for the collapse of the German government, which they believed would occur on an unspecified 'Day X'. They intended to seize control of eastern Germany and establish a far-right regime. Prosecutors described the group as holding racist and anti-Semitic beliefs, with plans for ethnic cleansing. The arrests involved over 450 officers across Germany, Austria, and Poland.
